intro: Cynoglossum zeylanicum, commonly known as Indian forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to South and Southeast Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features heart-shaped, velvety leaves and produces clusters of blue or violet flowers with five petals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade. The species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
